column5: Sorry to hear about that Beans  But by posting I know we will all think twice and be a bit more carefull  TB
sorry to hear about your loss

to bad about your cat beans, most brands of antifreeze have bittering agents in them now so this will happen less and less to pets and children as they gain use in the market. as long as it wasn't someone doing it on purpose then it is a  I know it may seem a bit early, but one of the neighbourhood cats just ahad a bunch of kittens

A bit too soon for taking on another cat just yet Ernie...  Thanks for all the kind words folks...  If this thread helps save one animal from suffering the same agony then Rocky's death served some purpose...  Cheers Mates  Beans

Warning   Anti-Freeze Spills   Due to somebody’s neglect to clean up / cover up a spill, our small cat died a horrible death…(burnt mouth and stomach, complete renal shutdown of kidneys and liver)  No animal deserves to die this way be it a dog, cat. skunk, raccoon, fox, etc.  We are posting this in the hope that your pet does not suffer the same fate and that our beloved “Rocky” did not die in vain…  I know that lots of us on the board drive old cars or like to do their own "flush and fills" but please be carefull to mop up afterwards...  So long Rocky...we sure miss you...    Geeeze...Who da thought a hard-bitten old wino from the corner of Coxwell and Queen St would get all blubbering over some silly little cat...
I'm sorry to hear of your tragedy, Norm.  Maybe we will all be a little more careful as a result of your loss.  Best to you and Maribeth.
Sorry Norm, I believe it causes kidney failure.

So sorry Norm. Most of us think the same way that you do about our feline and canine buddies. It is well known that anti-freeze is lethal to dogs and cats and unfortunately it seems to have a sweet pleasant taste to them.  Nothing silly about your feelings for Rocky.  John...

Sorry about your much loved pet . . . .    no shame in 'blubbering' about it . . . .    these creatures are 'family,' and can become very attached. I certainly hope this was purely accidental, and not somebody purposely setting this out for racoons, skunks & other pests!
Sorry to hear about your lost Beans.... My thoughts are with you.
Also, don't let your cats wander off your property where you have no control over what they drink!  This also ensures they don't piss on my door mat and poop in my kids sandbox, and my flower beds.

Lossing a loved one is tough, human or otherwise!  My condolonces upon your bereavement of a fine fellow.  Thanks for posting this as a reminder to properly store our waste from our autos.  Not only can it be marful to the environment but also can cause tradgey's such as this.
That is horrible, one reason why I no longer have outdoor cats.
That's a tough one Beans. I am sorry for your loss. Jim
Man that really stinks.  Sorry to hear about your loss, I know what you're going through.
Sorry to hear this beans, cats are not the only animals who would drink this sweet toxic antifreeze and dumping it down the drain is just as criminal!
sad to hear
Sorry to hear. I feel your pain, my cat die of liver failure.  Sorry again for your loss  Daniel
Sorry about the loss of Rocky Beans, hopefully people will take heed of your notice.

A family pet is a family member and their passing is most grevious, I'm sorry to hear of your tragic loss Norm.  I'm sure Rocky was a good and faithful cat.   Carelessness with antifreeze is just plain stupid!!!
losing a pet is never easy.....losing a pet because of someone's negligence is shameful.   Condolences!
Well that is just horrible Norm.  I'm very sorry to hear that.  You and Meribeth have my deepest sympathy.  I can't image losing my Felix.  Joey
I am so sorry also beans....  I have a darlin myself she is 16 yrs old next month.
Sorry to hear 'bout Rocky, Beans. Always sad to lose a pet, but worse when its caused by some slob.  Tie Twist !!!   If you read my Signature, you will understand the phrase; Get a life !!!!!!!!!
Sorry bout your loss norm!! Im still sad about the loss of my dog !! I know what your going through!
Not an easy thing to have to go through....sorry you lost Rocky...and how you lost him.  Thinking of you.

I'm sorry to hear about Rocky, Norm - and thanks for bringing this up. About three weeks ago I replaced a water pump on my Tahoe. I removed the old one and picked up the new one on the way to work using my van. While I was at work, I left the drain pan under the vehicle for at least 12 hours. Any number of critters could have gotten into it. I won't be doing that again. It would have taken an extra two minutes to tidy up. -Brian
So very sorry to hear about the loss of your kitten. As for Tie Twist's comment there is a time and place and this was definitely not the time!!!!  Sincerely, 1leg
